descript.abstract: DC Elementary School Attendance. This dataset shows D.C. public elementary school attendance areas, and added to the DC Geographic Information System (DC GIS) for the D.C. Office of the Chief Technology Officer (OCTO). The boundaries were recommended by the Advisory Committee on Student Assignment and accepted by the Mayor. These new boundaries will go into effect in the 2015-16 school year and significant phasing in policies will be put into place. See DME.dc.gov for more information. Current for the 2018-2019 school year.

attracc.attraccr: Data believed to be complete and accurate as of the time period cited. Subject to change. Digital version compared with original source data for accuracy and completeness. Validated by source and/or responsible agency.

dataqual.logic: Validated by source and/or responsible agency.
dataqual.complete: Data believed to be complete and accurate, subject to change. Digital version compared with original source data for accuracy and completeness. Data validated by source and/or responsible agency.

horizpa.horizpar: In process of validation by source and/or responsible agency.

procstep.procdesc: The process used to identify where there is a proposed change in rights for elementary, middle and high school is based on the following: Each of the approximately 9,000 sub block parts in Washington, DC is assigned to their current elementary, middle, and high school right(s). The current rights are based on current geographic school boundaries and multiple rights given due to closed schools. Sub block parts are based on census blocks that are split where current geographic school boundaries divide blocks. The DME’s technical team then assigned each sub block part to its proposed elementary, middle, and high school boundary based on the Advisory Committee on Student Assignment’s June 2014 boundary proposal. The current and proposed rights are compared and any change in rights is displayed as either an areas assigned to different school or an area reassigned to one of its present options.

cntorgp.cntorg: Office of the Deputy Mayor for Education

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.
